data.text: O death, how bitter is the remembrance of thee to a man that liveth at rest in his possessions,
O death, acceptable is thy sentence unto the needy,
Fear not the sentence of death,
And why art thou against the pleasure of the most High?
The children of sinners are abominable children,
The inheritance of sinnersâ€™ children shall perish,
The children will complain of an ungodly father,
Woe be unto you, ungodly men,
And if you be born, you shall be born to a curse;
All that are of the earth shall turn to earth again:
The mourning of men is about their bodies:
Have regard to thy name; for that shall continue with thee
A good life hath but few days:
My children, keep discipline in peace:
A man that hideth his foolishness is better
Therefore be shamefast according to my word:
Be ashamed of whoredom before father and mother:
Of an offence before a judge and ruler;
And of theft in regard of the place where thou sojournest,
And of silence before them that salute thee;
And to turn away thy face from thy kinsman;
Or to be overbusy with his maid,
Or of iterating and speaking again that which thou hast heard;
So shalt thou be truly shamefast,
